summary: As I listen to more campaign 2 for Crit Role, the more that the traveler makes me think of Kelsiers ghost that appears only to...
question: As I listen to more campaign 2 for Crit Role, the more that the traveler makes me think of Kelsiers ghost that appears only to Spook in book 3 of Mistborn.
answer:
Which is worse: that I came up with this basically spontaneously, or that I was vaguely thinking about it a few months ago.


Cleric Domain: Survival


Domain Spells:

  1. Expeditious Retreat, False Life
  2. Gentle Repose, Lesser Restoration
  3. Beacon of Hope, Revivify
  4. Aura of Life, Death Ward
  5. Mass Cure Wounds, Raise Dead

Level 1: Survive. If you are knocked to 0 HP but not killed, you may choose to immediately regain 1 HP through sheer force of will. You may do this once per Long Rest.

Level 2: Channel Divinity - Crew Leader. Using your Channel Divinity feature, you may take 1 minute to give an inspiring speech that grants temporary HP to up to 6 listeners. The temporary HP is equal to your Wisdom modifier plus cleric level and lasts until attacked down or the next Long Rest.

Level 6: Do Better. You may grant advantage to an attack, check, or saving throw that you can see within 60ft. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier. Uses renew after a Long Rest.

Level 17: Become Hope. As an action, you may grant advantage on all saving throws for one minute to up to 6 creatures you can see within 60 feet.

Which is worse: that I came up with this basically spontaneously, or that I was vaguely thinking about it a few months ago.

blog.name: nilim
blog.title: The sky may be falling, but the stars look good on you
blog.description:
D&D, Critical Role, Discworld. 
-
I create meta, gifsets, fanart and fanfiction.

My inbox is always open for prompts, and I love getting them... but no guarantees.

summary: Fjord is always described as small for a half orc and is oddly charismatic. What if hes a half elf half orc.
question: Fjord is always described as small for a half orc and is oddly charismatic. What if hes a half elf half orc.
answer:
I mean, those are some damn strong orc genes, 25% and still green. But I do find this a highly entertaining take. Nothing says Orcs can’t be charismatic, of course, but if that is his Elvish side poking through that could be a cheeky hint.

It would be even more interesting to know how Fjord himself would react to finding this out though. Right now Fjord’s story is also very much about self-acceptance, and specifically about accepting his orc side while having grown up in a mostly human society where people would poke fun at him. 

I think he’s quite curious about his orc heritage and we’ve seen him wanting to talk to orcs to learn more, so I think this background is quite an important part of his identity and story. But suddenly he’s going to learn he’s a quarter elf, too? What does that mean for his identity? He’s going to be such a confused boy.  

I do wonder what other traits he picked up with this background though, because jeez, this is a mixed bag ancestry. I mean… how long is his life-span even??

summary: How do you imagine Yeza is going to react to all of this if this is how they get him released? Do you think Nott will tell him...
question: How do you imagine Yeza is going to react to all of this if this is how they get him released? Do you think Nott will tell him who she is?
answer:
Yeza’s reaction is difficult to predict because we don’t actually know him. We’ve heard his voice, but not much of his character. Most of what we think we know, we only know through the rose-colored glasses of Nott. I do trust Nott’s judgement, especially as a victim of bullying most of her life which would probably mean she has a good nose for sniffing out insincerity. But we also know she can be… hyperbolic at times. 

Do I think Yeza is a kind man? Yes. But I don’t know how streetwise he is. We don’t know why Yeza was working with the Cerberus Assembly on their research. Was he coerced? Or was it voluntary? If it was voluntary, was it because he didn’t care about the potential harmful consequences of his work, and the military uses? Or was he oblivious and ignorant to it? 

I think in that last case, we would have a bit of bumbling Yeza; One who is kind, caring and book-smart but maybe not very wise at all. A bit oblivious. I think that Yeza would be very relieved to be rescued, but maybe not even realize how much trouble he was potentially in. I also think he wouldn’t give two shits that his wife is a goblin now, because all that matters is that she’s back. Can you imagine having a loved one come back from the dead, but just in another body? You have to be extraordinarily callous to reject them, and I really don’t think Yeza is. 

However, if Yeza was coerced to work with the Assembly, he’d maybe be whole lot less ignorant. He’d also very grateful to be rescued, because he’d know exactly what shitstorm he’d landed in. On the other hand, he might also be suspicious of being suddenly released; who are these people he’s never seen before? Why do they care about him and want to free him? Are they with the Assembly? Or is this another trick by the Kryn? 

And also, if he was immediately introduced to his ‘dead wife’, now returned as Goblin…. Well, how can he be sure she’s actually who she claims she is? What if it is a ploy to gain his trust? Their first few conversations might be… strained, to say the least. 

As for Nott, I think the time for deception has kind of come and gone, whatever she had planned. Jester has made references to Yeza through sending that his wife is looking for him. Nott screamed to a full court of people that Yeza is her husband. If Yeza were to be freed by the Kryn because the M9 did them such a great favour, there’s a high chance they might mention he’s being released because his wife requested it. 

I still think Nott is feeling incredibly apprehensive about the whole thing, so might slink into the background at first, or maybe even use disguise self to make herself look like Veth. But overall, she just… has to be honest eventually.

blog.name: acepalindrome
blog.title: you're going to be something extraordinary
blog.description: Hello, this is Palindrome! I'm currently doing my best to pretend that I'm a functional and well adjusted adult, with varying levels of success! Around this neck of the woods you'll find history stuff, nature stuff, whatever fandoms I'm into at the moment, fanfics I write when I can muster up the energy, the occasional mental breakdown and a variety of fun facts I come across or things I find interesting. Feel free to follow or drop me a line, I promise I'm quite tame.

summary: I know there are gonna be lots of interesting discussions about the current situation next week with the more intelligent party...
body: I know there are gonna be lots of interesting discussions about the current situation next week with the more intelligent party members, but I’m suffering from Caduceus withdrawal and I just want to see him roaming around the palace being pleasant to all these swell drow folks until he finds his way to the kitchen so he can finally try out his new cook books.

reblog.comment: I know there are gonna be lots of interesting discussions about the current situation next week with the more intelligent party members, but I’m suffering from Caduceus withdrawal and I just want to see him roaming around the palace being pleasant to all these swell drow folks until he finds his way to the kitchen so he can finally try out his new cook books.

Asexual/Aromantic 
Fangirl who spends way to much time thinking about Anime and Cartoons

tags: while drinking tea and reading smut
summary: So thoughts on critical role, I know people are wonder what the M9 are going to do after episode 56,and about them getting...
body:
So thoughts on critical role, I know people are wonder what the M9 are going to do after episode 56,and about them getting involved in the war and everything.

But what if, they figure out that the Cerberus assembly are the ones causing the war and the trouble (because I’m sure they are and I’m pretty sure with what the bright queen will tell them and the exposition they’ll get they’ll be able to figure it out).

What if the M9 instead of fighting in the war start to covertly get both the empire/ the king and the bright queen to work together against the assembly.

Just these utter idiots getting the king and empress in a room and Caduceus offering tea and Jester referring the romance of the first smut book she got and everyone being themselves while awkwardly trying to create peace.

And then just huge alliance going after the assembly and just.


I don’t know if this will happened but I love the idea of them just being in a random bar with the king and empress (both disguised obviously) and having peace talks that evolve into them joining another drinking contest like in Hupperduke or starting a bar fight (while any other NPC’s like Bryce or someone who they meet after just there like ‘…wtf’)

summary: You like critical role they are going to a convention somewhere this year (sorry can’t remember where) but if you go to cons you...
question: You like critical role they are going to a convention somewhere this year (sorry can’t remember where) but if you go to cons you could probably meet them.
answer: Unfortunately, where I live doesn’t get cons (I literally have to travel 7 hours to get to a city that does…and they aren’t even big cons, just local types) so I’d have to have a LOT of money to afford to go to any con, couple that with my anxiety and cons are just out of my realm.

summary: Not a fairy tale, but a trope sorta. Scanlan the known heartthrob has a reputation for saving princesses and the like (he always...
question: Not a fairy tale, but a trope sorta. Scanlan the known heartthrob has a reputation for saving princesses and the like (he always just legal loopholed his way through it in debate, never really fought) and one day takes part in a challenge to save one particular princess from a castle. One of the other competitors is the duo team of Grog and Pike, humble but competent heroes. Cue mild shenanigans as they coordinate trying to beat each other while also not leaving the other to die while also (1/?)
answer:
Sassing and teasing and flirting and insulting whenever they cross paths. Scanlan uses Grog’s cut path through the bramblewood forest and crashes w the two of them every night, but Pike never wakes him in the morning so he travels alone. Scanlan and Bigby’s hand save Pike when she falls off the rickety bridge over lava but simply deposits her at the other side with a blown kiss as he flies off on his hand. They finally meet at the top of the tallest tower where they’re all stumped cos they (2/?)

Cant get through the door until Vex and Vax rock up and pick the lock. Before then they spend a night or two just kinda sitting and chatting and its all very jovial cos unlike at the start of the competition theyve all proved theyre worthy of each others respect. When the twins get there they all go in together and Keyleth (the princess in the tower) fucking decimates them cos druids are an amazing class but Vax manages a heart to heart and Scanlan looks so injured so immediately she takes pity

Unifying through competition is one of my favorite tropes!
